thread.title: Johnny Manziel, girlfriend Colleen Crowley respond: 'We are all good'
thread.title_full: Johnny Manziel, girlfriend Colleen Crowley respond: 'We are all good' | cleveland.com

author: Mary Kay Cabot, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: Johnny Manziel, girlfriend Colleen Crowley respond: 'We are all good'
text:
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- Johnny Manziel and his girlfriend Colleen Crowley took to social media Friday to explain their argument on Monday that began on the highway and ended up on an exit ramp with police questioning them and letting them go.
Alcohol was involved, which is a concern, because Manziel spent 10 weeks in an addiction treatment center in the offseason.
It's also a concern, because the police report states that Crowley said Manziel hit her and shoved her head into the window. There was no evidence of bodily harm on Crowley, except for a wrist abrasion that resulted from Manziel trying to stop her from getting out of the car.
Avon Sgt. George Ruple told Northeast Ohio Media Group that Manziel did not appear to be impaired and admitted to having two drinks earlier that day. Crowley was impaired, Ruple said.
She did not want to press charges and neither of them were arrested.
The Browns have talked to Manziel about the incident and said in a statement from general manager Ray Farmer "it is a matter that we take seriously.''
The NFL also said it is aware and would have no further comment at this time. Colleen and I got into a dumb public argument on the way home Monday afternoon. It probably looked more interesting than it was and...
— Johnny Manziel (@JManziel2) October 16, 2015 I know I would stop and check if I saw a couple arguing on the side of the road. It was embarrassing but not serious...
— Johnny Manziel (@JManziel2) October 16, 2015 and when we talked to the police and they realized everything was alright and I was sober, we went home together and everything is fine.
— Johnny Manziel (@JManziel2) October 16, 2015
Before things get blown out of proportion.
A photo posted by Colleen Crowley (@coll_crowley) on Oct 16, 2015 at 3:15pm PDT
